latest.title: Loan Agreement
latest.content:
7 Oct 2025 09:52
RNS Number : 3836C
AIQ Limited
07 October 2025
7 October 2025
AIQ Limited
("AIQ" or the "Company")
Loan Agreement
AIQ (LSE: AIQ) advises that it entered into an agreement, on 3 October 2025, with Li Chun Chung, an Executive Director of the Company, for an interest-free, unsecured loan of GBP100,000 (the "Loan Agreement"), which is re-payable upon demand. The monies will be used by the Company for working capital purposes.
The Loan Agreement is deemed to be a related party transaction by virtue of Mr. Li being an Executive Director. Harry Chathli and Dwight Mighty, being Independent Non-Executive Chairman and Non-Executive Director of the Company respectively, consider that the terms of the Loan Agreement are fair and reasonable insofar as the Company's shareholders are concerned.

latest.title: Second Price Monitoring Extn
latest.content:
6 Oct 2022 11:05
RNS Number : 0382C
AIQ Limited
06 October 2022
Second Price Monitoring Extension
A second and final Price Monitoring Extension has been activated in this security. The auction call period is extended in this security for a further 5 minutes.
Following the first price monitoring extension this security would still have executed more than a pre-determined percentage above or below the price of the most recent automated execution today. London Stock Exchange electronic order book users have a final opportunity to review the prices and sizes of orders entered in this security prior to the auction execution.
The applicable percentage is set by reference to a security's Millennium Exchange sector. This is set out in the Sector Breakdown tab of the Parameters document at
www.londonstockexchange.com/tradingservices

latest.title: Price Monitoring Extension
latest.content:
6 Oct 2022 11:00
RNS Number : 0379C
AIQ Limited
06 October 2022
Price Monitoring Extension
The auction call period has been extended in this security by 5 minutes.
Auction call extensions give London Stock Exchange electronic order book users a further opportunity to review the prices and sizes of orders entered in an individual security's auction call before the execution occurs. A price monitoring extension is activated when the matching process would have otherwise resulted in an execution price that is a pre-determined percentage above or below the price of the most recent automated execution today.
The applicable percentage is set by reference to a security's Millennium Exchange sector. This is set out in the Sector Breakdown tab of the Parameters document at
www.londonstockexchange.com/tradingservices

latest.title: Directorate Change
latest.content:
6 Oct 2022 07:00
RNS Number : 9497B
AIQ Limited
06 October 2022
6 October 2022
AIQ Limited
("AIQ" or the "Company")
Directorate Change
AIQ Limited (LSE: AIQ) announces
that, with immediate effect, Graham Duncan is stepping down from the Board of AIQ to pursue other interests and Aditya Chathli, who has been a Non-Executive Director of the Company since January 2018, has assumed the role of Chairman. The Company also announces the appointment of Dwight Mighty as a Non-Executive Director, also with immediate effect.
Dwight Mighty holds an MBA in Finance from Henley Management College and is an Associate of the Chartered Institute of Bankers in England. He is currently a Non-Executive Director of Hawkwing plc, a cash shell listed on London Stock Exchange's Main Market. Dwight specialises in private company and private equity advisory, with a focus of the leisure/sport and media sectors. He has spent over 15 years in the private equity sector, latterly as a senior director with Gresham Private Equity and prior to this with HSBC Private Equity. He was one of the founders of AIM-listed company, TLA Worldwide plc, a sports marketing and management business, where he was Chief Operating Officer until 2019.
Aditya Chathli, Chairman of AIQ, said: "On behalf of t
he Board, I would like to take the opportunity to thank Graham for his significant contribution to AIQ during his tenure as Chairman. We wish him every success as he moves on to focus on other business interests. We are also delighted to welcome Dwight to the Board, who brings ample experience in guiding companies as they grow and develop, and we look forward to benefitting from his expertise."
Other than below, there are no matters to be disclosed in accordance with LR 9.6.13 with regards to Dwight's appointment:
Dwight was appointed as a director of Critical Care Transfers Ltd on 7 April 2011 and resigned on 14 June 2012. On 14 June 2012, the company went into administration. The administration ended on 11 December 2013 and the company was dissolved on 16 May 2017.

latest.title: Strategic partnership with Centslink
latest.content:
6 May 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 2989H
AIQ Limited
06 May 2025
6 May 2025
AIQ Limited
("AIQ" or the "Company")
AIQ establishes strategic partnership with Centslink
MoU signed to pursue data centre construction projects
AIQ (LSE: AIQ) announces that it has signed a Memorandum of Understanding ("MoU") with Centslink, a technology-driven enterprise specialising in the design, construction and delivery of data centre infrastructure and management, for the purpose of pursuing data centre construction projects in Southeast Asia.
Headquartered in Dubai, Centslink provides comprehensive solutions tailored to the needs of clients across the Middle East, Africa, Asia-Pacific, and other key global markets. It offers end-to-end data centre development services, covering every stage from site selection and feasibility studies through to architectural design, systems integration, project execution, management commissioning, operations and maintenance. With a highly experienced engineering team and a strong track record, Centslink has delivered modular and scalable data centre projects for sectors including energy, government, finance, and telecommunications.
The demand for data centres in Southeast Asia is growing rapidly, with the value of the data centre construction market forecast to increase from $5.4bn in 2024 to $11.8bn in 2030 (
source
). AIQ and Centslink intend to seek to capitalise on this development by jointly pursuing data centre projects, leveraging the experience and expertise of Centslink and the local knowledge and network of AIQ as well as its status as a publicly-listed company on the London Stock Exchange. As part of this, Centslink also intends to introduce AIQ to its partners, which represents further potential opportunities for the Company. However, there can be no guarantee that any of this activity will result in the award of a contract or the generation of revenue.
Li Chun Chung, Executive Director of AIQ, said: "We are delighted to have entered this strategic partnership with Centslink. The market for data centres in Southeast Asia is significant and by combining our expertise and experience, we are well-positioned to capitalise on the demand for the construction of new facilities. We hope to update shareholders on our progress in due course."
Enquiries
